content.description: Climbs above spray paint name sake. Well featured face follows bolts right of the roof. Make a big move just above the roof up to nice rail. A small hand traverse and crimps lead to chains.

Stick clip the first bolt, for full points create a rock stack on the left side of the cave, starting on dark black jug pocket. Execute a tough rightward move, past the obvious large scar. A tough move gains the ledge and after a short rest further sustained climbing above.  

  The guidebook says yard-up to the first bolt, but for full value don't bother.
content.location: The first bolt is just above the middle of the entrance to the cave

content.description: Having a tough week at work or school? Is the stress of covid lockdowns and the 24/hr news cycle got you feeling down? Perhaps you have a tweak in your neck from too much belaying without those fancy glasses. If you answered “yes” to any of these question, a visit to Spa Monegaw is what you need. Treat yourself to the ultimate deep immersion rock spa therapy experience. Spa Monegaw’s signature combination of therapeutically sculpted jugs, gently overhang terrain and healing sandstone features will undoubtedly release your inner sparkle.
content.location: A line of glue-in bolts between North of North 40 and Pinkerton.

content.description: Right of the cave. There is a particular clip that must be approached with caution above the midway ledge.
Campus start from a jug pocket, and work your way through the bulge on good holds. Two mantels and the beautiful arete finish make it worth your while.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall.

content.description: Left of Wayne Burnside, climb to roof and make a couple powerful overhung moves to surmount the tiered roof, cruise to top
content.location: Route starts just left of the "Wayne Burnside" spray painted on the wall and is directly under the right side of the big roof.

content.description: Easy climbing left of the cave leads to a standing rest. Bust a bouldery move and hang on until the chains.
content.location: The first route on the left side of the cave,

content.description: Stick clip, then execute a strange technical sequence on sugary rock to jugs and a second bolt. A powerful jug-to-jug deadpoint gains the third bolt and a good rest. Execute a V4 boulder problem or dyno through, and mantle over a ledge into a no-hands rest. Solve two more short problems separated by a ledge. Were this route not interrupted by two no-hands rests, it would be 4 stars and one of the best routes in the state.
content.location: Between Chief Monegaw (roof route without the chain) and resistance (leftmost route with arête finish).

content.description: Start at the base of the zig zagging flake. A few big moves gets you to the massive roof. Pull over the roof with a few powerful moves. Mantle up the tiered ledges for a thin finish.
The first wall you encounter from the parking area, marked by the first sizable cave. Many excellent climbs ranging from 5.10a-5.12-
